Key: She's late...

(I looked at my watch and muttered again for the
umpteenth time.)
Hey, Kotori!

Are you ready yet? We need to go soon, or we won't
make it in time.
Ahhh. Hold on, hold on～!

(I heard her running all over the house. Eventually,
she jumped out with a travel bag.)
Sorry, sorry, Thanks for waiting, Shido! Let's go.

(Kotori was out of breath, and her trademark ribbon
twitched.)
You sure dressed up, Kotori.
Oh, could you tell?
I mean, I'm able to go on a trip with you!
(Kotori smiled happily and twirled on the spot.)
If you were that excited, then that makes me happy.

Yeah. It seems like you couldn't sleep much last
night, either.
(Kotori said it with a bit of a mean look.)
I couldn't help it. I was excited, too.
Like the day before a school picnic?
More than that.

(If I'm going to travel with just Kotori, then of course
I'd be excited about it.)

(I was so excited last night that I couldn't sleep
and overslept this morning.)

But it's all thanks to you that we can go on a trip
like this.
Well, I wouldn't say it's thanks to me.

(Although Kotori and I are able to go out today, it
wasn't that easy.)

(Both Kotori and I are underage, so an overnight trip
required approvals.)

(Since our midterms were coming up, we could only get
approval if we got better grades.)

(So I had Kotori tutor me, but she was so intense...
I guess to having a younger person tutor you isn't
something to be particularly proud of...)

(The biggest worry on the day of the test was whether
I could get to school on time. That was pretty much
it.)

I guess it's thanks to you, Kotori... So I appreciate
your help.
That kind of sounded half-assed.

It's fine, though. You worked hard for me, Shido. And
that makes me happy.

You also kept your promise of us going on a trip alone.
Thanks, Shido.
I needed to do that much, at least.

(I don't remember when, but I was the one who made
that promise to her. Whether I'm her brother or her
boyfriend, I have to keep my word.)

(Anyways, we got the approvals we needed, so we're
going to have fun!)
All right, let's get going. Do you have everything?

Hold on. Okay, so a change of clothes, snacks, a guide
book, and airplane tickets.
Okay, we have it all.
Okay, let's go.
(Kotori reached her hand out, and I took it in mine.)

(We held hands and started to walk. Kotori really
looked happy.)
Hey Shido. Let's plan for the next trip, okay?

Oh, come on. We're just starting the first one. You're
getting ahead of yourself.

What gives? There are so many more places I want to
go.

And you'll keep your promise, right Shido? That's even
more of a reason to start planning now.

The next one, and the next one, and all the trips
we're going to plan for a lifetime.

Of course you'll be coming with me on every single
one of them.

No matter where I go, you'll always be with me, Shido!
And by the way, this isn't an order.
Then what is it?
A favor.

A favor instead of an order, huh... That makes me
happy.
Why?
Because you always order me around.

You have a point. But this is a favor... and a
promise. Got it?
(Kotori wrapped her pinky around mine.)
I love you, Shido. So much. Forever and ever.

I love you too, Kotori. I love you so much. Let's be
together forever.
Okay. And this won't be our last trip either, okay?
Of course. Maybe the next one can be our honeymoon.
G-Gosh! Where did that come from?!
Haha... Sorry.

(Under the bright sky, we made a new promise to each
other.)
